title: A Topology-Driven Invariant Mass Kernel in Swirl--String Theory (SST):\\ Reference Implementation and Benchmark Against Atomic and Molecular Masses
description:
This manuscript documents a canonical reference implementation of the Swirl--String Theory (SST) invariant mass kernel, as encoded in . The kernel maps a topological object \(T\) (specified by braid index \(b_T\), Seifert genus \(g_T\), component count \(n_T\), and a dimensionless total ropelength \(L_{}(T)\)) into an inertial mass \(M(T)\) via a fixed, mode-independent functional.
            Three computation paths are supported:  (strict evaluation with fixed quark-geometry factors),  (single baryon-sector normalization fixed by the proton), and  (analytic closure in which the proton and neutron are matched exactly without modifying the kernel).
            A semi-empirical nuclear binding correction is used to map nucleon-level predictions to atomic masses.
            In the  mode (electron, proton, neutron exact by construction), the benchmark over elements H--U yields mean absolute percentage error \({\) with maximum absolute error \({\) for the fixed \((Z,N)\) table used. A small molecule set (19 formulas) yields mean absolute percentage error \({\).
